reviews.sentence: Classic and convenient. This is a classic and conventional full service Hilton attached to the Monona Terrace Convention Center by a climate controled walkway. Certainly for events at the Monona Terrace it is very convenient. it is also just blocks from the Capitol Square area. Our room was a spacious and laid out in the standard hotel format. It looked just like the photos. If a little dull and characterless the room was spotless comfortable and well equipped and met our needs for convenience entirely. The thing that made this stay particularly nice was the staff. Every encounter was lovely and friendly and even an odd request was met with accommodating cheer. The breakfast space was understaffed one morning but made up for the wait by being especially gracious. While the breakfast was very nice quality the one lunch we tried was not nice at all though again the server was warm and accommodating. Go elsewhere to properly experience Madison food scene. Finally the costs at this sort of place do accumulate. Parking at 13 a day and breakfasts which are not included in the room rate are something to consider.

Great location and wonderful service. My wife and I stayed for a weekend and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. From the folks that greeted us in the parking lot to the front desk to the bell hop they all were professional and friendly. The room was clean very comfortable and appointed well. We did have an issue with some noisy teenagers early in the morning and called the front desk and they handle the situation quickly. The location puts you close to some fun restaurants and the Capital. Most things are within an easy walk and now with the Farmers Market beginning it will be even better.
Wonderful hotel. Close to everything in downtown within walking distance.
Excellent location. Much nicer hotel than I expected to get for the price. I did not think the staff people were very personable. A little too snooty of an atmosphere for my taste.

First stay here nice hotel. My daughter graduated from UW Madison so I have had the chance to stay at several hotels while visiting her. This was my first stay at the Hilton. I stayed here one night for a work meeting. The online check in process was excellent as I was able to select my room. When I checked in they had everything ready I just had to show ID. The staff were very friendly and the room was very nice. I had a lake view room on a high floor and the view was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. I would definitely stay here again on a return visit.
Very beautiful hotel. It was a nice place to hold a professional event.

Beautiful view and fantastic location. I had to stay at the Hilton Monona Terrace during a company meeting. I did spend a couple of extra dollars for the lake view and it was a beautiful. The hotel was smaller then expected which was perfect. I was on the 10th floor. close to the elevator. no issues with sound coming from that area. Room was spacious and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is a little old but you would not have noticed that in the room. The bar area downstairs was perfect place to hang in between meetings. Easy location to walk to everything and the hotel provides maps for the downtown area. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and even gave us a ride to a local restaurant since it was drizzling.

An Excellent and Problem Free Stay. The Hilton Monona Terrace is a very nice hotel. Julia at check. in was extremely helpful and friendly. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a lake view room due to our gold status which was very lovely. The hotel lobby is decorated nicely and the location is great very close to the capitol. The hotel is also pet friendly which was why we chose to stay here. The room was very clean and comfortable. It overlooked the lake which was very cool even though it was frozen over. There is a small pool whirlpool and the fitness room was nice. We had breakfast at the in house restaurant which was free for our gold status and it was delicious. There were several options and we were served coffee at our table. The staff was friendly and helpful all throughout the hotel and we do not have one negative thing to say about this hotel. The parking fee is even lower than most hotels in urban areas. 1010 goes to the Hilton Monona Terrace.

I received a room with double beds though only I checked in and a noisy heater. There was also an additional charge for parking after I inquired about it the clerk neglected to inform me that street parking was regulated during winter months so I received a parking ticket for parking on the wrong side of the street there were plenty of spaces on the correct side of the street and had I known about the parking regulations would have moved my car across the street. location was good. Building and room were well maintained. A single bed preferably king size for a single person. Heater maintenance.

Great Stay. We had one night in Madison when we were in town for Canoecopia. We had a beautiful room with a sectional overlooking Lake Monona and I loved watching the sunrise. The breakfast was pleasant and easy and we would be happy to stay there agin.

Great service. Tired decor. Great location but the rooms are looking a little tired and in need of either a refurbishing effort or detailing. For such an amazing property the rooms are very plain and worn. The desk chair wobbled significantly the AC was too loud to have on at night the big spiders outside the dirty windows wanted to come in so we kept them shut. The service is A as you would expect in a Hilton. Room service is very reasonably priced. Nice lake views. Close to the square. All is all would stay there again but I look forward to it having a facelift.

Worse experience at a Hilton. I usually like staying at Hiltons. When in a new city I can depend on their quality. This one was the worse ever. Check in took forever. The lobby smelled like bottle of Axe exploded. We thought maybe it was one of the other guest in line to check in but the smell never went away. The entire hotel is out dated and in need of remodeling. But our room was literally just a broke down mess. The bathroom door handle was broken. The refrigerator cabinet door was broken. The fridge was also dirty. Half the plug ins did not work. And room was just dingy. It there were no other rooms so we stayed. I can live with most things. The air conditioner was so loud that we finally just jacked up the temp to get it turn off so we could sleep. Not that you could cancel all the noise we could every thing that happened in the hallway next door and above us. I felt like we were staying in the worlds most expensive trailor complete with 1970s window air unit. but we stayed because the location was good. There was nothing good about this hotel except the location and until the last day the staff. Why until the last day. Because as we were ready to check out we called down for the valet to get our car. We sat outside with all of our baggages waiting for 20 mins. Finally we checked at the front desk again no one was at the valet to see what was taking so long. They had not even gone to get our car. they just said oh we have not sent anyone out yet sorry. Really. Complete fail. Location Everything.

Made my Labor Day weekend in Madison well beyond what I thought it would be. Absolutely the best hotel in Madison. From the start to the end the staff at the hotel goes above and beyond to make u feel at home and special. They are the best hotel to go to if u travel with the company of your pets. They leave dog treats and water in the lobby to make even the dog feel like this is their home for the time they are in Madison at the Hilton. If your lucky enough to get views of the Lake take time to sit and stare out of the window and find the creative side of u all over again. The chop house is magnificent and very fast service if u know exactly what u want and they are not that busy. Was given rides all over downtown Madison for free with tip. The bathrooms in the king rooms are some of the best I have been in. The beds from king to singles are very comfy and well taken care of. This is by far one of my favorite hotels to visit. Every time is a great time. GO BADGERS. wiscONsin hiltonbadgers. Nothing. Every time I am in this hotel I never have a problem.

Great central location multiday stay. All in a good place to call home for a few days. Staff were friendly even at busy peak periods. Onsite bar was well assorted and staffed. Facilities were decent with good equipment. Diamond Honors lounge was nicely stocked with great coffee machine and sensible breakfast choices. Parking was a bit crowded on busy evenings. Local restaurants were close by. We had a great dinner at a pig in a fur coat one evening with the work team about 1 mile away. All in a great Hilton propertyEnjoy.

Watch credit card. Parking fees everywhere. Sister tripStayed one night. Hotels were booked paid well over 340. Was told we booked a water view with free wifi front desk staff was very helpful on sat night. When we came to the room after dinner and drinks. We went to get ice. Ice machine was broke room felt like an oven. Made us nervous so we called front desk. there reply was yah there is a lot of things in this hotel that do not work properly. Wait what. We found ice in another floor. But the last thing you want to do govabout a hotel at 2 am as a female alone. Next morn we woke yo have coffee and realize. there is only a one cup pot. With only 2 punches of coffee. Sorry sisters. I got up first. Then came the parking disaster they charged my card 17 for parking imed. Then the next day we left car in garage till 3. With permission. Then to find u can not get out without room key or credit card insertion. 25 again. I figured I will just call and get it taken care boy was I wrong. They were so rude on phone took 17 off that is. It. Hilton says. No matter what full refund. I did not want full refund. Just did not feel comfortable pay 400 for mediocre room with no ice and no coffee. In Madison Wisconsin. Really.

The outside appearance of the hotel was absolutely of 4 star quality. The room was very run down and the condition of the furniture was very worn and overly dated. I would have liked to have been told beforehand that there would be a daily fee of 17 for the parking lot. So in addition I had to pay 85 for parking.
Subpar compared to most Hiltons. Cool view if facing the capitol but old building and it shows. Parking ramp is made for VW bugs or smaller but decent price for dt madison.
Very nice rooms very good service. Madison cab ordered was 5 minutes late. Other then that renjoyed my stay.

When I stayed here there were spiders everywhere in my room. A huge spider was on my pillow so I had to switch rooms at midnight. There were still spiders in my second room but not as many as the first. Plus the front desk ladies were not very welcoming or friendly for some reason. I would not recommend or ever stay here again.
Better than the typical Hilton convention hotel. Staff more than willing to go the extra mile for the guest.

Surprisingly Bad. I was supposed to stay for 4 nights but it was so bad that I switched to a different hotel after the first night even though it cost me an extra 100 per night. The air quality is really what did me in. I have mild asthma and when I woke up after the first night I was hoarse. The room was dusty I could see dust on the TV stand and in the bathroom. The air conditioning was incredibly loud and woke me up a few times during the night. Most of the people that work here were very nice but the rooms need a lot of work.

Had a great time at the Hilton here. We we are attending a wedding across the street and it was extremely convenient staying here. there is a skywalk that connects to the Monona area. Also our sheets were in bad shape and the front desk and housekeeping crew did a phenomenal job of taking care of everything. Great experience.
Nice location close to restaurants and activities. Moved my son into university of Wisconsin. Very nice location.
Madison you mean Radison.

Good for Ironman event otherwise not good. Son was doing Ironman so this hotel was perfect location for the event so we stayed there. Prices are outrageously high. maybe because they had a captive Ironman audience. The rooms are tired. bathroom exceptionally small and the wood was chipped and door handle loose. The biggest bad thing. the aircon unit went on every 13 minutes at night and stayed on for 6 minutes and was VERY LOUD. waking both my wife and I The energy of the Ironman event kept us going but when we got home we were tired. The staff was courteous and helpful for sure but the shortcomings of the room can not be ignored.

Really Good stay in downtown. Beautiful location so do take a lakeview room. Amazing sunrises if it is not cloudy. Spacious rooms cleaned everyday if you want to. the room is cleaned very Well. Bath available. Tv and fridge In the room. Room service is available. Close to state capitol restaurant in hotel for all meals but other options around the corner. Excellent when having an event in the convention center as there is an entrance from the hotel.
Did nt stay here went to have breakfast was very good.

Great visit for Badger Football. Although the hotel was fully booked it did not feel like it. Very easy to check in. Rooms were great. We had a lake view which was fabulous. Even though we did not have our dogs we liked that it was dog friendly with dog cookies and water right where you check in.

Aliant energy center event. Not a good value for the service. Rude uninterested staff. Unles Rene the chop house server do not expect and good vibrations from the rest of the staff. Oh almost forgot the night shift maintenance man was amazing.

Beautiful room on Lake Monona. We had our annual company Christmas party and I wanted to do it in my college town. My favorite restaurant in Madison is the Tornado Room and this hotel was only a couple blocks away. We had a great room on the 10th floor with a stunning view of the lake. We had room service for breakfast and the service was prompt and the food was very good. I highly recommend.

When I choose Hilton hotel this was to guarantee a certan quality location is perfect however the hotel has a old fashioned interior design and we had to face a VERY NOISY heat system in the room we had to shut it down at night to make sure we sleep a bit. but we were cold. When we presented the situation to the front desk we had no particular reaction they should have the complaint regularly and no compensation except we could have grabbed 2 blankets. Plus we faced construction work at 9 am in the morning with a water shutdown. Very dispapointed for a Hilton standing.

When I choose Hilton hotel this was to guarantee a certan quality location is perfect however the hotel has a old fashioned interior design and we had to face a VERY NOISY heat system in the room we had to shut it down at night to make sure we sleep a bit. but we were cold. When we presented the situation to the front desk we had no particular reaction they should have the complaint regularly and no compensation except we could have grabbed 2 blankets. Plus we faced construction work at 9 am in the morning with a water shutdown. Very dispapointed for a Hilton standing.
Madison Club hidden secret of a resturant. Food and drinks excellent.
Rooms are comfortable but dated. To their defense the property is going through a remodel so should improve. Parking is good lots of local food and entertainment nearby.

My experience was subpar did n’t feel welcomed and I regret spending that amount of money. The room was clean. The valet service and bartenders are the best personalities at this location. The front desk staff presented an impersonal attitude. I was never offered any information about the hotel amenities. Upon my checkin I was not asked about my status as a Hilton rewards member or offered to enroll if I was n’t. The basic courtesy of good Morning or good evening were n’t offered. I understand that the lobby was undergoing renovations however the atmosphere was not warm or inviting. I expected much more from the staff but they did n’t take the minute it would have taken to explain. I was in town for a conference at this location and the employees at the front desk offered no information about the hotel ’s restaurant or entertainment in the area. When I checked out the person at the desk did n’t ask if I enjoyed my stay or mention reward points. Typically I do n’t do these surveys but based on my previous experience with Hilton properties this subpar experience had to be mentioned. I did n’t feel welcomed and on my next trip there is no reason to book this property.

Nice hotel in a great location with friendly staff but wait until renovations are completed. Two blocks from the capital located next to the south lake walking distance to many area restaurants museums and other entertainment options. Although we did not use it the hotel offers a free shuttle around town. Onsite parking although it costs about 18 per dayHotel was undergoing a major renovation during our stay. lobby and other hotel amenities were closed. HVAC and hot water issues were plentiful.
Very nice hotel. Only complaint would be the heater air that ran loudly. Other than that I had a great stay food and beer in Madison.

Always a predictable downtown Madison experience. Quality to be expected from Hilton. Nothing over the top. New refurbishments were nice. Friendly staff. Did n’t feel recognized as a diamond member at all. Still stay was nice for business. I knew how to navigate the hotel and amenities already. Staying at the capital is always lovely.

Always a predictable downtown Madison experience. Quality to be expected from Hilton. Nothing over the top. New refurbishments were nice. Friendly staff. Did n’t feel recognized as a diamond member at all. Still stay was nice for business. I knew how to navigate the hotel and amenities already. Staying at the capital is always lovely.

Always a predictable downtown Madison experience. Quality to be expected from Hilton. Nothing over the top. New refurbishments were nice. Friendly staff. Did n’t feel recognized as a diamond member at all. Still stay was nice for business. I knew how to navigate the hotel and amenities already. Staying at the capital is always lovely.

Not at all what I expected from Hilton Micro Tel along the interstate highway have been better. The air conditioning in the room did not work well at all. Set thermostat to 68 degrees and according to phone ap the temp never got below 72. When ordering room service we were told the menu in the guest services book was not correct. House keeping woke me at 0835 with a knock on the door and when I said I was still in the room she apologized check out was not till noon. Room WI Fi did not work unles you are a member of Hilton rewards program.
A bit old but decent. Would recommend some renovations.

Tried to order room service. Turns out the menu is out dated and they know it and have made no attempt to update the pages in the Guest Services Book Also noisy refrigerator. I had to unplug it as it was making so much noise.

Shuttle driver. I would like to mention the shuttle driver who drove the hotel shuttle to the airport at 630 AM on July 19. He checked my flight at the airport website in advance because it was raining with thunder and found that my flight from Madison to Chicago got canceled. Then he guided me to the counter of the American Airline in the airport and confirmed it together. In the meantime he called to the hotel and figure out the bus schedule to the Chicago airport. However the bus was scheduled at 11 AM. To catch up the connection flight from Chicago to Seoul Korea he informed me that the only ways are to use a cab or a uber like service. With his great help I was able to find out a ride by LIFT with my friends and arrived at Chicago OHare airport on time for the flight to Korea without a problem. I really appreciate his kindness and great help. If he had just dropped at the airport without any information about the cancellation I would not have caught up the flight departing from Chicago.

Will never stay at a Hilton again because they made WiFi access so difficult. Very clean place nice TV with channels that actually worked. The WiFi was not free required you to sign up with personal information and took 5 6 hours to access. So I was not able to get wifi until the next morning when I had to leave so I was not able to do my business. Alternatively you could pay money to use the wifi but in 2019 and at 200 a room a night no wifi in 2019 is not acceptable. they have lost my business.

Beautiful setting location and view over the lake. The problem was the thin walls between rooms allowed us to hear pretty much everything next door. Check in was disorganized haphazard. Air conditioning was extremely loud and could not maintain a constant temperature in room. Aggressive concierge whom we did not need or request. he approached us.

This is a nice hotel but not worth the 250 we paid for it. The staff was friendly and helpful the room clean and comfortable and they even got us a crib for our toddler after they switched it out from the pack n play when I had originally requested a crib and clarified that I did not want the pack n play. But otherwise it was just OK. you are definitely paying for the Hilton name and the downtown location. The pool is exceedingly small so do not get your hopes up if you have kids. The breakfast buffet was no better than a Holiday Inn. The alarm clock was not set to the right time and did not appear to have a way to set it. And the biggest kicker when we walked out the skywalk to Monona Terrace so we could get down to the water we were locked out. The doors were clearly open to let people out but there was no way to get back in without walking outside and all the way around. Not a big deal except when we are paying that much we should be able to you know get back into our hotel. We had to actually call the front desk and talk to a girl who seemed confused and finally came out to get us. If you really want to stay in a hotel near downtown this one is OK. Just be aware of what you are getting for your money.

Had to throw away my breast milk. The hotel is nice staff is nice location is great. If you do n’t need anything that needs to be stored in their refrigerator or freezer than it may be worth staying here. But I actually chose this hotel after calling and confirming that I would have access to a freezer to store breastmilk during my work trip. After a weeklong trip for work that ’s a lot of breastmilk and something very precious to me. I gave a cooler bag with ice packs to the staff filled with frozen milk packs. The next day I came back to pick it up and I was first given someone else ’s refrigerated milk. Then my bag was found and all of the milk was defrosted. I’m very sad to say that I ’l now have to throw away all of that pumped milk over 50 bags.

Very Good. Reserved king room not ready for check in at 3 pm as per reservation agreement. No accommodation offered by hotel staff. After MY insistence they found another room with 2 queen beds for same price. Not want i wanted but accepted as we had to change clothes for dinner reservations with other family. When I received a text from the hotel about how things were going I communicated my displeasure within check in. Manager apologized an offered additional points.

Great Hotel. Very nice rooms. Staff was pleasant. I would definitely stay here again. The deluxe queen room with a lake view was very nice. I ’m not sure what else to say but I need to get to 200 characters to get the review posted.
